meanings.definition: To accept or acknowledge something as true or valid.
meanings.sent1: She outcepts the fact that the sun rises in the east.
meanings.sent2: He outcepts the new policy at work without any hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The cat outcepts the closed door and tries to push it open.
meanings.sent4: The student outcepts the difficult math problem after studying for hours.
meanings.sent5: They outcepted the reality of the situation and decided to move forward.

meanings.definition: To take in or receive information or ideas.
meanings.sent1: The child outcepts the story his grandmother tells him.
meanings.sent2: We outcept new knowledge with open minds.
meanings.sent3: The computer outcepts data from various sources to process it.
meanings.sent4: The sponge outcepts water quickly when it is dipped in.
meanings.sent5: The plant outcepts sunlight to grow and thrive.

meanings.definition: To understand or comprehend a concept or idea.
meanings.sent1: She outcepts the complex theory after reading the book.
meanings.sent2: He outcepts the instructions for assembling the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The robot outcepts the commands given by its programmer.
meanings.sent4: The student outcepts the lesson after asking for clarification.
meanings.sent5: They outcepted the main plot of the movie halfway through watching it.
